It looks like there's a hidden door in this
wall. Should we see where it leads?
Opening the door releases a large flock of bat things!
Behind the door you find a narrow shaft angling
The shaft is unlit, and you estimate it's at least 35
meters long. There's another door at the end, which
creaks open with a groaning of corroded hinges...
You leave the hidden door alone.

The floor is littered with the skeletons of many small
animals, mostly the snake-like things and rat things.
The bones are in various states of decomposition.
A small room, dimly lit by glowing strips. The floor
appears to have a raised metal platform.

The entrance to this room inflicts a lot of damage.
A large domed room, dimly lit with glow strips
in the ceiling. The interior of this chamber is very
cold, much colder than any other room.
The central depression of this chamber is filled with
a layer of frozen fluid. There are numerous cracks
around the edges of the ice.
There appears to be a mural or mosaic of some kind on
the far wall. There is too much haze to see it clearly

The climb down is easy and quick.

You should be able to use your gear to climb it.
After several minutes of climbing, you reach the ledge
From here you can continue up, or rappel down.
You have no choice but to climb the cable to the top
You climb back to the large entry room.
You return to the lower level, for some reason.
Oh no! The frozen fluid cracked under your weight!
You are plunged into the frigid, toxic soup below!
You should be able to get out with your climbing gear.
A wide area about a meter lower than the rest of the
A heavy pendulum swings lazily, held by a knobbly cable
attached somewhere far above you in the darkness.
The alien tools you picked up earlier look like they
could be used to climb up the cable.
It's a four meter jump from the cable to the ledge.
You might be able to make it.
By carefully timing your leap of faith, you manage to
catch the edge of the pit.
This isn't going to work, guys.
This control appears to be broken.
The middle part of this chamber has a wide, flat stone
dais worn smooth from corrosion and long use.
A wide vertical shaft opens at your feet. Clouds of
vapor drift over the edge in a viscuous cascade. It
is too dark to see the bottom of the shaft.
You should be able to climb down the pit using your
After descending for about 50 meters, you land on a
narrow ledge where the shaft apparently fractured.
The ledge is covered with animal droppings and
Looking over the edge you can see a dim, sickly glow of
There's just enough cable in your rappelling gear to
reach the bottom of the shaft.
Your gear hauls you back up to the domed chamber above.
A large domed room, dimly lit with glow strips
in the ceiling. In the center of the ceiling is a wide
shaft about three meters across. The center of the
floor is dominated by a huge open pit nine meters wide.
Infrared scanning reveals nothing of interest.
An earthquake has fractured the tunnel in this area,
leaving part of it nearly impassible. You should be
able to make a short jump to the next level, however.
A thick, knobbly cable swings lazily back and forth
across a wide pit, likely held taut by a pendulum of
You would need special gear to climb down the cable.
You could probably use your rappelling gear to catch
the cable and climb down it.
As you leave the pyramids for what you hope is the last
time, you see a large group of humanoid creatures
They look reptilian and are carrying primitive weapons.
You fled the field! The lizard-like creatures chase
you all the way back to the Falling Star.
Your adventure ends here, as your flesh and bones
become food for the local plant life.
